i not john cleese although i thought fawlty towers was but i am a fan and when i saw this sitting neglected a shelf my local blockbuster i decided give it a try what i got was a surprise and one the funniest minute viewing experiences i have ever had the writing is typical english goon show in fact as an audio this would not be out of place on a firesign album but the execution and timing is spot on and this elevates into the kind of jawdropping performance that can create british comedy the brits have a gift for combining broadly with observed of and timing and the creators use both to good here cleeses portrayal of holmes seems to owe much to the arkins and sellers clouseau however cleese has such a for physical comedy that he more holds his own but the unexpected treat here is arthur lowe who plays watson as an genial but invincibly uncomprehending imbecile with such superb timing and delivery that he becomes the best aspect of the film i would never heard of lowe before this his background seems to be vaudeville and musical theater but he justifies his entire career with this performance as far as i am concernedsome people might not care for strange case especially if british whimsy is not their cuppa tea but i am extremely glad i got to see this before it vanished from sight

john carpenters halloween is quite horror masterpiece it tells the immortal story escaped mental patient michael myers who returns his hometown halloween night to stalk and kill a of babysittersthis was the first and without doubt the best in the halloween franchise carpenter shows great restraint in pacing the story very slowly and building likable unusual for a horror pictureeven more unusual is the nonexistence of blood and gore and yet it remains the scariest halloween to date get that halloween marked the film debut of jamie lee curtis and a defining point in the late great donald pleasances career a true classic

in the classic sense the four which are not specific the concept of funny or even entertainment altmans health treats all of the humors and actually in very funny there is the as by lauren bacalls very slow guarded and protective esther brill who is mission in life appears to be all about appearance protecting the secrets of her age and more her there is paul dooleys dr gil gainey who fish out of water perhaps more like a seal flops around and exhorting the to subscribe to his aquatic madness the melancholy of glenda jacksons isabella garnell of shakespeares troubled and selfrighteous even a soliloquy or two and let us not forget henry gibsons bile character bobby hammer the breast that feeds the baby rules the world then there is the characters harry wolff and gloria burbank james garner and carol burnett respectively relatively sane characters striving to find some kind of balance amongst all the companion and extreme humors who have convened for health a kind of world trade organization specializing in health which is to say anything but health this is altman at his classic best

i was france around march and i love to this film festivals i knew about this cinémas damérique latine de toulouse but i have never to it i decided to go and then i caught cero y four the film is stunning it does not caused the impact on me with the mexican users because it was frenchsubtitled but it is still shockingthis film is satire about urban about kidnapping and crime on the streets in mexico it is a crude portrait the city of a secuestro express with a stunning mia maestro which was also a satire of kidnapping but with a more serious tone has and i think so some kind of connection with cero y van four a of redemption story and that how much is too much man on fire that was stunningly strong was also not a satire but a crude portrait into the streets of mexico or it is like the brave one a film that shocks and hits you in the guts very hard this is like the usual suspects it has some plot twists and turns but that makes it even more believable verdict a film that shocks and makes you believe that there is no security on the streets anymore stunning impressive and astonishing performances cero y van four is a film that you will not forget soon leaves you shaking and stunned

spoilersin the words jeanpaul hell is other in the odd couple jack lemmon and walter matthau how accurate this can be as felix ungar and oscar madison lemmon and matthau respectively create good friends who decide live together as the two to slowly grow more and more frustrated with each other the laughs come thick and fast felix departs leaving oscar changed and more cleanly individualjack lemmon as ungar is absolutely as the cleaning obsessed coping with life as a single man walter matthau in contrast to lemmons is equally as good as the sports writer who simply wants to play poker to money for his child benefitslemmon and matthau are magnificant in their selected parts to some degree dependent upon the by neil simon and simultaneously because they work well as a team as two friends who are different in although similar in relationships with exwives and children these two late great create a partnership which is practically impossible to recreate so great in fact that the world screamed out so much for something similar that two before matthaus death and before lemmons the were reunited in an inferior sequel this idea following irritating obsession with sequels might have to a certain degree but the same time it could never come close to the genius of this original filmultimately it is not really possible to say anything else with simons amazing script filled with humour and laughter the creators of this film were already onto a hit the casting of jack lemmon and walter matthau as felix ungar and oscar madison though is the most important part of this film the odd couple with it is traditional soundtrack which even gained a tribute in the simpsons it is script and it is genius leading men is a tribute to cinema and a feature for history to remember

off there absolutely no flirting going on anthony or anyone else these people do not flirt they just do it your first test of endurance is to wade more than fifteen minutes of violence and perversion this not so bad hell i like violence and perversion as much as the reviewer but without a context to put it in it is repellent so you make it through the torture and mayhem then we meet donna and the movie turns into something all together not better just different a picture without heart there are lame attempts at comedy to cameos broadly written and broadly by broads like judy tenuta and mink and a few hookers and drag queens they all deserve better the photography is purposely disorienting so if you motion sickness or really any kind of sickness this flick is not for you come to think of it i am not sure just who this flick is for except maybe gay and bisexual sm fans who like poorly scripted poorly shot indy films about themselves

what fall ellisyou gather a bunch of your friends at all about the follow of sean ellis you have an vague idea of the plot no spoilers kill the fun very expectationsit late at for a movie of typefifteenminutes passes and you start telling yourself it is bound to pick up at twentyfivemins you start wondering if you should just go to sleep and save this for another time you can fully appreciate the expected not existent subtle touches over the half hour you realize half of your your hyped up is asleep and call it a daya few days later when you exhaust all other material to watch you go back to this the of the day this time hoping your mood you awake this time minutes later you find yourself fastforwarding the unbelievably and needlessly long intermediate transitions and images any other stuff i would have given up already but there is cashback and its legacy but that legacy can only carry you so long this is a new level of boring moviemaking imagine a short story extended to a novel with just descriptions this is what it isdecent cast is wasted there is no cinematography that leaves you in awe like cashback either there are films that annoy you there are films that lack certain aspects or just cheesy unfortunately this is just a waste of timefinal words stay away

possibly of the worst movies i have ever seen i do not care what the critics say it is bad i the problem is kunderas it is not it is unfilmable it is just that like ninetynine of his it is pretentious and overdrawn he to enamored with himselfhis characters come off as navelgazing and his novels as a whole are misogynistic i have read many of his even his socialist realist poetry that truly awful i just do not understand what the fuss is about characteristics like the selfabsorption his novels make infuriating reading in a movie all the things that i dislike about kundera were magnified maybe i just something but i do not think so on a side note i can not believe that this is a criterion collection dvd no way is this movie that essential

there are many kinds reunion shows one kind is where are taken out of and set recreate they have not played for twenty or thirty these have mixed results return to mayberry despite some silliness was okay return to green acres as eddie albert used word for the i will not repeat here but both it and the movie stink rescue from gilligans island filled in a necessary gap in the story of the though the show itself was silly even from a gilligans island viewpoint in most cases the scripts are weak a silliness appears in the scripts that is too knowing  and in comedy it is nearly fatal for the characters to know they are being funny new characters are introduced who do not fit the mix in the main these reunion shows are pretty weak a second of reunion show is the kind where the cast lays its aside but sits around telling stories with flashbacks from the shows then there are movies based the shows which are rarely good and movies based on the history of the show the bunch has had both of these happen to it with various resultsreturn to the uses nearly all the above with a twisted viewpoint which makes it the best of the reunion shows and has raised the bar for the othersadam west and burt ward and to a showing of the original while they are there the car is stolen the adam west of the movie is a man demented he called jerry his butler alfred he opens a bust of shakespeare in his apartment and reveals a hidden pole to slide down to the parking garage he is obsessed with being a crime fighter when in fact he is merely a up when the batmobile is stolen he not only believes it is his duty as a crime fighter to recover it he drags and unwilling burt ward in as his assistantthe pursuit is largely with west and ward reminiscing about the old days it is broken by flashbacks with actors playing west and ward in the old days the scenes and the flashbacks both have the wacky of the show maintained there are also running gags that show west is able to make fun of himself in wards book about his time on the show he about wests and also his being a skinflint west makes ward pay for everything in their pursuit down to tips and bus fare the clues they follow the characters they meet even in flashback all fit the of the old series and there are several including a fist fight with written sound effectsthe whole thing is funny and done with great there are also cameos by julie newmar looking she is had one facelift too many and frank gorshin reminding us why he has such a cult following gorshin will be the when jim carey his obvious successor is long forgotten the movie builds to a fairly obvious but funny climaxthis show is a model for reunion shows  there are few that can fit the pattern this show had actors replaying their old characters young actors playing a movie about the making of the show the actors west and ward reminiscing and a modernday movie with the adam west playing the demented adam west it has everything if you loved the old show this is the stopper on the bottle

the brain that would not die was considered so distasteful in one thousand nine hundred and fiftynine that several cuts and the passage was required it was released in one thousand nine hundred and sixtytwo today it is difficult how anyone could have taken the thing seriously even in one thousand nine hundred and fiftynine the thing is both lurid and lewd but it is also ludicrous in of waythe story of course concerns a who is an eager experimenter in transplanting limbsand when his girl friend is killed in a car crash he rushes her to his secret with the aid of a few telephone a couple of clamps and what looks very a shallow baking pan he brings her head back to life but is she grateful not hardly in fact she seems ticked off about the whole thing particularly when it that the doctor plans to attach her head to bodyas it happens the doctor is picky about this new he wants one for speed and he takes to cruising women city sidewalks strip joints visiting body contests and hunting down cheesecake in of endowments that will raise his but back the lab the head has developed a chemicallyinduced psychic link with another one of the experiments this one so that it is kept locked out of sight in a laboratory closet can they work together to get rid of the bitter and malicious lab assistance wreck revenge upon the doctor and save the body he for could be leading man jason evers plays the doctor as if he is been given a massive dose of spanish fly virginia leith the unhappy head and in spite of the fact that she has no lungs and maybe not even any babes to incredibly music make changes from line to line the is even more nonsensical the plot and you will need a calculator to add up the on the whole the brain that would not die comes off as even more unintentionally funny than an ed wood moviedirector joseph green actually manages to keep the whole thing moving at pretty good clip and looking at the film today it is easy to pick out scenes that influenced later directors who no doubt saw the thing when they were young and impressionable and never quite got over it the cuts made before the film into release are forever lost but the cuts made for television have been restored in the alpha release and while the film and sound quality are not particularly great it is as well to recall that they probably were not all that good to withnow this is one of those movies that you will either find incredibly dull or wildly depending on your point of view so it is very hard to give a recommendation but i will say this if your tastes run to the of ed wood or russ meyers you need to snap this one up and now four stars for its cheesybizarreness alone gft amazon

that magical moment in life that point between the innocence and the confusing whirlwind that marks this is what this movie is all about danni played by reese witherspoon is right that moment in life when the movie she over elvis playing his records and wishfully thinking about love maureen her sister will soon be off college has no trouble with attracting boys is beautiful and seems to have it all figured out although she does not she dates local loser who is is also after her and wishes she could find a decent boy and be swept off her feet danni most young teenagers wishes she could be anyone else but herself because most teenagers think that who they are just is not good enough she wants to be maureen but does not see that she is beautiful herselfthe moment adulthood begins to itself upon her life is when she meets court foster for the first time court who is father has recently died has moved to their farm to work it with his mother and younger he has been thrust responsibility when he should be having fun one hot day he goes to the pond and jumps in only to find danni skinny dipping they yell and argue and danni leaves but they see each other a day later when courts mother is invited to dannis to visit old friendsdannis parents danni becomes attracted to court and court to danni she is a tomboy and is spunky has attitude and what is on her mind court is and danni and he knows it but they continue to grow closer with their days at the pond between court working the farm by the time court kisses her one day danni is smitten dannis father tells her to court to the house and he does but things are uncomfortable for court on his of date the silence though is broken by his meeting with maureen who has yet to see court one between the two and its all over the looks of pain and defeat on dannis face are both beautiful in their to life and painful at the same time the rest of the movie i will not tell but the movie has more to it a relationship between a boy and two sistersthe greatness of the movie is in its depiction of lifes moments both beautiful and painful and the relationship between two love is tested by both a boy that they love and the pain they must endure both together and individually danni eventually marks her entrance into the world when she that the world is unfair painful and maybe even a little hopeful than when the movie started few movies can truly capture the wonder of childhood and the pain of adulthood so perfectly this movie has since the first time i watched it stuck in my mind its in the my top one hundred movie list and deservedly so i only wish more movies like this were made because if so my faith in hollywood would be a lot better

my favourite jane austen emma is wellmeaning her flaws so can forgive and her and the relationship mr knightley which is familiar respectful but playful generating warm fuzzy romantic mr knightley is the man and emma is as close as you to clever confident woman she is only twentyone and sure to have matured and of her flaws who does not want to emma who does not want to be told off by mr knightley of emma gives you no sense of the things that i love about emma i could not even watching it i just it so awful i could not that warm generous of emma which drives the to love her the patience and warmth she to her father the closeness her and weston which demonstrates her willingness to put her friends happiness her own as she sacrifices the only equal companion in her household by forwarding miss taylors marriage mr woodhouses character in this adaptation just appears bizarre rather than just quaint elderly and a bit tryingthis adaptation most importantly fails bring to life the relationship between mr knightley and emma their relationship is built on mutual respect and affection mr knightley is indulgent of emmas minor faults trusting that her intelligence and genuine care for others will never allow her to go terribly astray and emma looks up to him though playfully hiding this and continuing to use her own judgement the dressing down he gives her right at the beginning of the show completely overstates the argument between them and ruins all possibility of portraying the nature of their relationship as i have described above mr knightley is also insufficiently attractive to bring to life the sexual tension between the leads or to inspire any admiration from the female viewersreally horrible i can not understand why anyone who truly like the novel emma could like it unless it miraculously redeems itself after the point i switched it off

this little seen movie is and laidback it veers away from some the of the genre and adopts a looser approach it is about a searching for her missing lover a psychiatrist who has suddenly vanished for no reason her leads her a populated by a of individuals in true giallo style is never far awaythe cast is really rather good we have aldofo celi thunderball alida valli horst frank cat of nine tails and a very young eightys scream queen the lead actress is rosemary dexter and while i not with her she does a good job in leading the pictureone of the defining features of eye in the is its music atypically for a giallo it features a jazzrock fusion soundtrack this score composed by roberto nicolosi is reminiscent of miles davis especially his work in a silent way it is an soundtrack and really gives this movie a different feel most the fusion groove the languid atmosphere and the sunny that the film is mostly made up ofthis is a giallo so we really need to talk about the murder well this film falls a little short in this it is certainly not devoid of them but they are few and far between the opening dreammurder being probably the best on offer as well as a memorable burning car sequence but this really is not a particularly violent film still i do not think it should disappoint too many seasoned fans of the genre the mystery is fairly compelling and it has enough eccentric the idiot boy saro and that inappropriate dubbed and moments of the bizarre to satisfy while the sleazefactor is upheld with a smattering of nudity throughouteye in the labyrinth plays a giallo version of an agatha christie mystery as it features a group of unsympathetic characters in a villa all under suspicion of murder we have the obligatory flashbacks detailing their connections with the final hours of the highly unsympathetic murder victim while this is not a gradea example of the genre it is certainly an different one as it does not borrow too heavily from other of the subgenre for giallo enthusiasts i give this a thumbs up and hope one day it is given a nice dvd transfer it certainly deserves the treatment

usually something can afford to it is often first job the lack of film by everyone is truly on and film is no exceptionbut worse than that even by one thousand hundred and eightytwo standards this is so bad it is hysterically funny filmed entirely the chicago area on an obviously small budget of the by the entire cast is stiff wooden and cartoonish a cross a school and bad noise nearby traffic often drowns the dialog and the dialog is truly bad very declarative in a way that comes off as forced and expedient rather than natural and organic scenes are contrived and choppy and even though the characters go through a span of years neither the children nor the adults age at alli do believe it is possible to make a christian film that is palatable to a large secular audience but too often the creators of such films are so focused on the message or in this case their own autobiographical ties to the project that good film production values are tossed aside i am sure it is no coincidence that the main character has the same name as the producerdirectoreditor and cast member luckily michael madsen was much more interesting and believable to watch in his subsequent films careers like his are certainly not built on films like this one

the bfg of roald dahls but animated adaptation the just is not there this remains pretty faithful to dahls original so one can not lay the blame on hambleys script if anything the lies the colourless animation the lethargic and the generally lacklustre voiceovers one to expect this story to make a happy funfilled movie instead the is a hopelessly dull affair becomes quite tedious to watch children who are not familiar with the story should definitely read the all the film achieve is to put them off read what is actually a childrens classicyoung sophie voice of amanda root lives in a nonetoofriendly orphanage under the of clonkers one evening is the window she spots a massive figure walking down the village street the figure realises it seen so it in through the window and scoops sophie her bed placing her into its enormous pocket before fleeing into the sophie discovers that she has been kidnapped by a giant from giant country and fears that he will eat her but to her relief he turns to be a kind and member of his species who introduces himself as the bfg voice of the bfg refuses to eat people instead restricting himself to foultasting vegetables known as snozzcumbers however giant country is by numerous other who do feast every night as it happens on poor unsuspecting humans sophie and the bfg become great friends and soon they come with a plan to thwart the other giants together they go to the queen of voice of angela thorne with story and beg her to send the and the air force to fight the maneating giants the queen agrees and so begins a dangerous operation to capture the bad giants before they can anyone elsejason voices the bfg quite well one of the few pluses in the film but his good is almost ruined by somewhat poor sound quality the rest of the voice work is uninspired with very to bring the characters to life similarly the bfg is the only character that is imaginatively animated sophie lacks appeal and the giants are boringly designed and look almost indistinguishable from each other even the places are uninventive giant country especially comes up short being nothing more than a barren wasteland with occasional rocks and canyons at as the celebration christmas has through the whether one the religious or the it is time when are supposed a little better to each other that has slipped one ebenezer scrooge merchant and money lender in nineteenth londonas his nephew points out to his he does not keep christmas in any way because scrooge feels the whole thing is the humanity in scrooge was driven out long ago he is a hard a whole lot his twentyth century counterpart mr potter of bedford falls new yorkbut as charles this tale redemption is not too late for any of us and a lonely ghost and visit scrooge and show him howa christmas carol is such a holiday classic that we forget that it is as much a social commentary of nineteenth century great britain as oliver was the in this film are middle and class the cratchits are a couple of rungs above the people in oliver twist but they are having to struggle to stay up there still love and happiness their home no thanks to the guy bob cratchit for like george bailey who did a whole lot of good in his life and had to be reminded how much ebenezer scrooge needed a wake up call as to the he still had for some good in this worldpatrick stewart in his live performances and play has pretty much taken over the part of scrooge but george scott captures the old miser pretty well in this film the of him but with a trace of sadness that makes us root for him to change scott joins a fine tradition of people like reginald owen and alastair sim who have both done great interpretations of scroogeamong the supporting roles i particularly enjoyed david warner as bob cratchit and edward woodward as a hearty and stern spirit of christmas present according to imdb this is one of thirtytwo versions of a christmas carol made that they have archived and it is one of the best

i probably give more than it deserves because it halloween i just at knotts scary farm and i was a mood to watch a really halloween movieoh and it only cost me dollarusually i ffwd a movie like this to to the good stuff but i resisted the urge here and i am not sure why it was obvious the opening shots this was not a real movie not even a bmovie it is more in the of the decoteau horror movies like the brotherhood are shot on filmlook video about fifty cents in i was half afraid any minute one of his beefy college boys stagger rubbing himself in his underpants or something there were no cutaway shots expensive to do camera setups and flat lighting butit is hard to pinpoint there is something refreshing about watching a director no pull off a halfdecent movie the fact that he is even a halfdecent job is commendable and this movie it is share of meritsthe is not bad the photography is pretty good if too bright to scary there are some surprises and the whole thing is sort ofdifferent somehowa bunch of college kids are for some unknown reason in the warehouse they are the annual haunted house a creepy old man gives them a satanic and they accidentally summon the powers of hell this results in the people in the haunted house who they are made up to be and causing a of mayhem and human suffering along the way we are treated to oddly complex and lesbian relationship subplotit is interesting that this to be the wellrounded in the movie yes there is a sex but it is not salaciousor at least no more so than you would find in any legit movie about lesbians that them having sex it is rather for a horror to take the time and effort to do this without resorting to cheap exploitation the other thing about this that held my interest was how it was clearly trying to emulate the stupid kids have sex and get killed vibe of the eightys slashers it is hard to take that on because there are so many of that exist the genre has to death i am not sure if it is good or bad that these filmmakers simply tried to make another entry in that genre without as if it was still a living genre but i appreciated the attemptwhich is why i sat through it sometimes you just want to watch a mindless nobudget aforeffort horror film there really was too much set up not enough gore endless plotholes deadends and clichés and the unfortunate feel of a movie that simply did not have enough money it to be the film the producers envisionedbut at the very least the haunted house were pretty cool i would pay to go to that haunted house if it existed and did not mind paying a dollar to it on even if i will never watch this againoh and possible spoiler but there was great business with the vampire girl in the coffin i used to be claustrophobic but i have changed ha ha good one

sidney franklins the good earth has achieved classic status thanks story and especially from luis ranier who won an oscar for her portrayal olan rainers performance is so complete she is nearly unrecognizable having very little throughout the entire film and it is a long one rainer relies instead and language she looks and acts chinese to the point that anyone unfamiliar with her work could easily mistake her as suchthe film remains relevant today because it explores the to riches story and the universal themes that come with it when lung and olan finally achieve financial success after of famine and they find a life full of but in meaning it is only when they return to the earth after fighting off a swarm of locusts the special effects used to create them are still incredible and to watch that they again find a common formula with the unique perspective of a chinese family especially for one thousand nine hundred and thirtyseven makes the film a classic money is not worth anything without friends and family a point that the film drives home perfectly in it is last ten minutes with an emotionally fulfilling conclusion

when the us entered world war i the government forced hollywood out propaganda the little american is probably the best the lot because it stars mary pickfordpickford plays young torn between men jack holt german and raymond hatton french but her decision is delayed because of the war as both men enlistwhen the ship pickford is sailing is sunk by the germans think lusitania because it is carrying munitions pickford has a great scene as she stands on the lifeboat and yells the german later on of course she into both holt and hatton when she is being as a war prisoner at a châteaudirector cecil demille provides one truly great scene in this film as pickford and holt are wandering through a bombedout village they pass a destroyed church of which only one wall remains standing against the wall is a very large as they stand and watch the wall collapses but the jesus figure remains suspended in mid air it is a very surreal moment in a film that is otherwise very straightforward and unartsypickford is as a pleasure to watch she was always a very natural actress who avoided the many other of the day used she is also very very pretty holt is very good here in a leadingman role hatton is ok the list of actors in extra parts are wallace ramon novarro colleen moore ben alexander norman kerry walter long james neill and edythe chapmannot a great film but interesting to see us propaganda at work

i just on and decided to check the reviews this morning it i robot polarized the critical viewing here on imdb and given rise to a of insults and namecalling tooi find this somewhat surprising as this film not great or even good but neither is it terrible or even really bad what this film really is isdepressing that the us population is so ready to lap insipid clichéd reheats and them as this film as retread written all over it the plot an uneasy mix of asimov and modernday uberaction to smiths character a smartmouthed cynic with a backbone of titanium to the special effects that borrowed from matrix and a few othersi robot is sadly quite possibly the perfect action movie for todays audience superficial plot insipidly snappy dialog and lots and lots of adrenaline smith is mediocre but we already knew that he seems to be hollywoods latest unsuccessful attempt to create a black bruce willis the story has lots of holes in it of all sizes but i do not think most people drawn to this film are criticallyminded enough to notice perhaps a blockbuster by todays standards but very bmovie compared to true winners

bridgeport the deranged school teacher fenton johnathon schaech obsessed by the teenager student donna keppel brittany witnesses him murder her family to stay her but richard is arrested and to life three years later the traumatized donna is feeling better but is under psychological and taking pills on her prom she goes with her boyfriend porter and two couples of friends to the pacific grad hotel for the party but the psychopath richard escaped prison and is in the same floor in the hotel chasing donna stabbing her friends and staff of the hotel that cross his paththe forgettable slash prom night is a collection of clichés with a total lack of originality the stupid story is shallow and silly with a bad acting of johnathon schaech in the role of an insane killer the predictable screenplay is amazing since it is possible to foresee what is going to happen in the next scenes my vote is threetitle brazil a morte convida para dançar the death invites to dance

i not relate to it failed to engage me either emotionally or the dialogue very dense and uninvolving i could not connect and hence care about any of the characters and i am finding it hard to find much positive to say about have read that to understand it needs to be familiar with some of the more obscure aspects of catholic theology i will admit that as an atheist i probably am unfamiliar with many of the finer details of catholicism but i have also seen many films dealing with religious issues that have touched me because their themes are still universal to the human condition and do not rely on specialised knowledge or beliefs

the bourne ultimatum begins recklessly midchase and in pulsepounding explodes from there as jason bourne matt damon absolutely tracks down the masterminds behind the cia blackops that turned him into the perfect killer in final attempt learn his true identity a devastatingly icy david strathairn as the man behind the curtain is added to the returning cast including joan allen and julia stiles nonexistentlike the second entry in the series i wished paul greengrass shaky handheld would static for the few minutes of downtime however that being it is a perfect way to capture the tense claustrophobic feel of the intimate handtohandcombat scenes and equally well in the chase scenes which are mostly foot and across with the occasional big car pileup part of the fun of the bourne series is the constant globehopping and manipulation of technology and communications that seem to defy the laws of physics and current the bourne seem to exist in some of gritty that is full of technologicalbased magic it makes no sense that everyone seems to be in the right place at the right time but i will be if it is not a blast to watch them get therewith the of the and involving franka potente the writers attempt to create some emotional connection between damon and stiles but she is so blankfaced an actress it never really leads to anything still this can be forgiven for unlike the identity and the supremacy this ultimatum reveals all and we finally learn the about bournes it is an and satisfying conclusion to the series and if they have any good sense and damon gets his wish this will be the perfect end to it

there is no denying that ealing comedies are good but for me this film stands out as one the bestthe basic premise of the film is that small part of pimlico in london is discovered be part of burgundy not the uk we then follow the of the in their battle to keep the treasure found after the bomb explodes and keep out the black market who soon that being exempt from uk law rationing does not exist when they become in their own because the government has decided to close the we see them fight back against the systemthey are forced to ration water and food in their stand for what is right in fact becoming worse off they were it all started that is where the moral comes in it is when they loose all the food that they think they are beaten and call for a surrender only to have the whole of london to their by sending food lots of it thus enabling them to continue their strugglethis film hits the right note throughout the is with stanley holloway margaret hermione baddeley and betty warren standing out it is pitched right not too sentimental and the moral of the story not forced down your throat well worth a viewing

church by the gas scotland yard is called in but the killing continues who can stop this mad killer who seems to be able to come and as he in and out of the college what the killer what is not to about a killer who sneaks around wearing a red kkk looking complete with red gloves the white whip he carries and uses very effectively stands out nicely against the red although the idea of a killer in a red pointyhead outfit sneaking around a girls school is fairly farfetched it is one of the more sinister looking costumes i have seen sixtys music i really would like to track down the title music to the college girl murders it is got a jazzy hip sixtys feel to it that i loved bizarre touches beyond the killers red gown and the movie features a sliding a pit of alligators with a cage handing overhead poison spraying a placed gogo boots and mile high hair i would it as a cross between the sixtys batman tv show and an italian the college girl murders is a treat for the eye the end let us just say that there are more twists a mountain road just when you think the killer has been uncovered here comes a and and another and anotherwhat does not work chief sir john i know the guy was meant to be comic relief but his has way too much screen time why have alligators previously i the alligators in the pit and while they are a nice touch they serve very little purpose why go through all the trouble and not use them plodding plot some of the college girl murders has no flow or rhythm to it there are far too many moments throughout the movie when things come inexplicably to a halt better pacing would have made this a much more enjoyable moviei have not seen many of these german krimis but of the few i have seen phantom of soho strangler of blackmoor castle dead eyes of london this may be my favorite this one has a real feel to it that i really go into had the plot flowed a little better i could have easily given the college girl murders a seventen

first all i liked very much the central idea of locating the in the self various levels mainly but more in fact the intruders are throughout the film in the swissfrench border where the pretagonist leads life in the his recurring daydream and inside his ailing after heart transplantation in the last of the film he becomes himself returning in french colony in the hope of atoning for the the overall tone is bitter rather than pathetic full of regrets and guilts sense of failure being more or less dominant this is a quite grim picture of an old age ostensibly selfdependent but hopelessly void and lonely inside the directer composes the images more to convey passing sensations of anxiety and desire than any explicit meanings some of them are mesmerizing not devoid of humor though kind of absurdist play only somnambulist can visualize

big spoilers i have seen other takashi miike and the very disturbing and which was examination of the japanese ideals of femininity visitor q which i means visitor question he examines in a very disturbingly gross way the family unit miikes surreal vision of a dysfunctional family almost tries to lynchian in terms of confusion and filmmaking but ultimately lacks the style and we the are introduced to a bizarre array of scenarios the opening the father figure kenichi endo who was actually quite good paying sex with his displaced daughter fujiko then as the father returns he on the head by the visitor kazushi watanabe a fairly sizeable rock and for some reason they back at the family home the mother shungiku uchida is beaten and bullied by her son jun muto who is beaten and bullied by his school the visitor enters the home he somewhat menacingly establishes himself as of the unit eventually the family begin to improve relationship with from the visitor milking breasts murder and retaining a sense of family prideand there are other crazy that somehow bring the family together it is uncomfortable humour but is equally frustratingly silly and overthetop in its weirdness there is a necrophiliac scene that is utterly disgusting but up ridiculously funny as the scene progresses partly because of the situation itself and partly because you can not believe the filmmakers and the are actually the style of the film is poor to say the least and the plot is stupid and unbelievably weak the characters themselves are all over the place and i understand this is not to be there is hardly any interest in these confronting characters and situations as all of them border on the absurd the camerawork is sloppy and does not have that cinematic feel that lynchs entails it is hard to take this film on a surrealist level or on an of examining the family unit in it just that miike was to shock and the film seems selfaware that it is trying to be shocking and it becomes almost comical to be taken seriously all in all i say that this film is a bizarrely comedy but it looks and feels amateurish and seems to unnecessarily want to shock miikes previous film audition was finely balanced between disgusting horror character development and technique which established more intrigue in the way the film was crafted to allow the viewer to become engrossed with the plot visitor q is a step down as it tries too hard to be outlandishly bizarre and intentionally confronting without really having much to say in the process out of

i never fail be amazed and by the evil that has been predicated in the history the world in the of religion and it seems that the machinations of the catholic church in twentieth ireland rank right up there near the top considering that the of history and times should have had some sobering effecta love divided is the story of family by ignorant and prejudice all in the name of an church the of the film we are offered a view of the life in a small irish village in which and sean cloney are married with young children sean is catholic and sheila is but she has no qualms with their children being raised as catholic there is no sign of any animosity between the catholics and in the village the peaceful and loving relationships are soon shattered when sheila the desire to have their older child attend the protestant school the local takes it upon himself to forbid this sin and soon has husband and the entire catholic population of the village turned against her as well as her the local dairy in an of defiance and desperation sheila her two and flees from the areaspecial note should be given to orla who plays sheila she gives an powerful performance in which the is drawn in to the emotional trauma in which she decides to reject the wishes of a husband she deeply loves in order to express her desire to establish herself as independent from the pressures of the an equal footing is liam cunningham who plays sean for he gives a realistic portrait of a man not nearly as complex as his who is torn between his love for her and the influence of church and communityif fiction this film would have been a compelling and interesting drama considering it is true it changes to a horrific tragedy in real life the and the village never fully recovered from the events that place there it took a century for the church to its negative role in the events and even though sheila and sean lived out their in the area they never fully recovered from what was done to them by the religious leaders and their fellow villagerswhether it be denying basic rights to education of choice crashing planes into buildings subjugating women whole races or plain on and murder we humans certainly have the ability to use religion as a powerful negative force in our society

admittedly i find al pacino to a guilty he a fine actor of a woman he overdosed on himself i hoped of which i heard almost nothing would be a overlooked aheadofitstime intelligent and engaging citypolitical it notcity is a movie clouds its plot so many characters and citywide issues that a while you think its a plot in scope so broad and implicating that once you find out the truth it will blow your mind in truth however these subplots and digressions result ultimately in fairly tame and very familiar urban story trademarks such as corruption of power twofaced politicians mafia with police ties etc and theoretically this setup allows for some thrilling tension the fear that none of the characters are safe and anything could happen but again it really does notunfortunately the only things that happen are quite predictable and we are left with several confession monologues that are meant as a whole to form modern a fable of sorts a lesson in the moral ambiguity of the real world of politics and society but after one hundred and ten minutes of names and missing reports and a spiderweb of lies and coverups the audience is usually treated to a somewhat satisfying reveal i do not think we are left with that in city hall and while it is a very full film i do not find it altogether rich

i decidedly not in the target for this film i am man nearly who has only recently stumbled across the world independent film this happened quite by accident with the discovery of a movie called late one night television the first things i noticed about that film were that it was one technically and two written when i read an interview with the in the local paper and he that one of his influences was clerks i started get interesting when he said his main influence was the station agent a movie i would seen on dvd a week prior i decided i had to and check it out the result could be described along the same lines as clerks although the two are nothing alike content wise both films suffer from that are overcome through amazing writing whereas clerks is a day in the life of a man who has nothing in his life all and is afraid to ask tough questions about himself and his situation me is about a man who seemingly forces himself to be constantly busy he is running one way or filling his life with little things so that he will never have to deal with the big ones the themes and ideas of this film are strong and poignant i can tell from watching it that not much has changed since i was growing up young men still have the same problems they always have the writer up these problems and themes in the crafts honest and has them do completely believable things as far as indie cinema goes this may not be perfect from a technical standpoint but from an artistic one it is very close

on the back burner years so it reported reunion of two of the characters sitcom started off badly and went downhill there richards mary tyler and her best friend rhoda morgenstern valerie harper meet in a long estrangement and on lives what a concept but sad to relate nothing worth talking about let making a movie about happened to either of them in the years so instead the script itself throwing one hoary old plot device after another most having to do with older women in the workplace while completely missing the quirky charm and sophistication that made the original show a winner the supporting cast is instantly forgettable the humor is nonexistent and the chemistry which moore and harper once had together is gone moore allegedly stalled this project for years waiting for just the right script before committing herself if this was the one she considered right what on earth were the ones she turned down like it is not the age of the characters that does this in for time inevitably marches on but the almost complete lack of imagination coupled with a blatant disregard for the elements that made the series work at one time this was intended as a pilot but all to obviously it failed to generate any interest among potential sponsors or for that matter among potential audiences quickly and mercifully forgotten the film is a travesty and an insult to a classic

show and an unrealized classic the league gentlemen remains as one of the greatest comedies of recent timeswith a dark and bizarre style of that towers over the tired formulaic approach of it is inferior yet far more acknowledged successor little britain the league of gentlemen was truly something special during a rather quiet in british comedyup until it is arrival the scene there had never really been anything the league of gentlemen on the surface a seemingly simplistic sketch show the show soon unfolds as a sinister but universe populated with all manner of comedic what really sets the show apart from it is rivals is it is approach telling us it is story rather serve us barely distinguishable from the next here we see each individual or of through their various journeys and story lines no visit to them is the same and each time they offer us up with a surprisegradually over series and a christmas special the fictional of royston vasey is with a yet hilarious and that is probably the main reason why the show is such a joy to watch and also the reason why the show would easily merit more series unlike other current shows like the catherine tate show or more importantly little britain the league both know when a has run it is course and have the opportunity to deal with that several fan favorites who could have easily been kept on to entertain further bowed out before the series came to a close giving room for fellow characters to grow more or allow for the introduction of newer of royston vasey to make their markanother thing that sets this show above is that the writing team approach the process with care and as before all four members of the league have a sound mind when it comes to judging the longevity of their creations and when it is time to call it quits in respect to certain characters this awareness has also meant the league of gentlemen undergoes a bold evolution not usually seen in a show of this the narrative driven and far darker series is a brave step away from the more sketch based first series and this bold move by the league really pays off with the third series there is of an urgency for them to please an and like the christmas special they individual stories with a clear narrative unlike the more sketchbased previous series that succesfully binded together various sets of sketches into a series long story arcthe third series is both a change of pace of style as well as a treat for fans who have already seen the first two despite some polarized opinion on the third series any real fan of the league will what the third series has to offer as well as really enjoy the more character based episodes that only deeper into fan favorites but pair up and interwine characters that might not have crossed paths previouslyit might take a little trying to get into the change in style but it is definitely worth it and in my opinion the third series is the best and also provides a firm conclusion to the shows not without it is and very occasionally certain characters and set pieces appear somewhat out of place but for the most part the genius writing dark nature of the show and the host of brilliant characters that are all too close to real life make for a real treat and prove what comedy should be about and puts much of the more recent catch phrase driven and often desperate attempts comedy to

seven if you are kid if you claim be an adult this semisequel to the lion king to spin off side timone and pumba the original story through their eyes including the story how they in the grand tradition of disney inferior sequels are made and occasionally tv series featuring the adventures of minor characters from their biggest hits you can be as sceptical as you want about this but and fans of the series will likely not care their are enough jokes and songs and interesting things to ensure that this is one of the few above sequels this because of the charm of the muchloved central characters the quick pace the injokes involving the first film and for older viewers there are some funny gags the animation is as good as ever if a little flamboyant the original but the plot here is all about taking it easy matatatimone and pumba decide to watch the events of the first film frequently stopping midfilm to joke about parts of it a we see how timone is a near he feels he does not fit in and decides to looking beyond what he sees to find his ideal home the way he meets pumba outcast and they become friends soon they meet simba a lion cub natural predator of t and but they form a trio however when simba realises he must follow his own destiny and leave the it is up to the to decide whether to help or not and how of course the usual disney and themes are here friendship good evil etc the plot is simple but works on many levels making it smarter than your average animated movie as the movies appear disneys traditional form must become smarter but not forget the which made them popular toy story and all that have come since have been with jokes to suit all ages and it seems this is the way the market is shifting however there will be a place for like this and you can not go wrong buying this for the youngstersseven out of ten

the summer has been so full blockbusters and comebacks of and not some of the disappointments of those comebacks that i was woe to find film i could sit down and enjoy in you do not want to read further down the page there are not any spoilers i will sum it up here it is more mature ella there are some questionably violent parts plenty of death and a handful of scenes with a little blood not for small children but does not try to be overly corny or its bounds think of it as a bit more serious bit more magical princess bride and you will be close i perhaps not as prodigious a movie as maybe once or twice a month if i feel active i am also a huge scififantasy fan i get bored of remade story lines and films with more flash than filling faster than you can count to ten and this film is the diamond in the roughby the end here i was tired enough of fractured expectations from the big hits that i averted seeing bourne ultimatum in favor of stardust having had my hopes by transformers for my fiction addiction the previews of stardust seemed appealing but i was certainly waryas many others here i was utterly surprised i had gone in thinking to see generic fantasy movie from here to breakfast do not be it is most definitely a fairytale and it does indeed have witches magic and utterly requires suspension of disbelief but the most thing i found is that it is not based anything i have seen or read in the and it is actually a really good movieunlike ninety of the other movies which seem to reappear in a side perhaps a sign that hollywood is running out of ideas i could read a book this year and in years the movie would be out as another epic fantasy tale the of lotr and the rest so the nyt and such and such no doubtstardust did not have me bolted to my seat because of jampacked action turn nor was i because of plothook after plothook threatening to tear the dramatic tension apart and throughout the in a boom it did not even use enormous blasts of sound to grab my attention to what is on screen transformers i am looking at you it is not trying to show off the latest cgi nor did it my with and story lines that are simple enough i could have figured them out in threerd grade boy i hate those i just watched watched and enjoyed a storyline unfold my eyes sure i may have known what was going to happen throughout most of the film but it makes you forget that it even made my heart at some parts but the most important i noticed is that i left the theater feeling better than when i would gone init truly is a gem after so much slush this summer with so many remakes and films that fell short of my expectations this was like a cold sweet cup of tea to cap off all the hard work i would done sitting through the others trying to come out of them with my moneys worthit is probably not for everyone but do yourself a favor if you enjoy fantasy films that stand the test of time alone princess bride black the dark etc then you should really see this movie this little diamond is finding its way into my dvd collection the moment it hits stores you can trust me on thissimply

may and her husband visit their children and the visit is awkward because the grandchildren and do not really seem to know each other as one might expect the warmth that should be there is missing after dinner mays husband he does not feel well blames it his and says he wants to go home he dies that nightmay now is lost she clearly did not have a passionate marriage or a very interesting one but she had a purpose she had someone who needed her and even though her own needs had gone unmet for she had something to do with her daysshe is depressed and unmotivated she goes to stay with her daughter paula who shortly after her arrival let us her mother know that she has never felt that her mother has given much herself all she let us loose with anger over her mothers of may seems and surprised yet she also does not seem to have the or the desire to really make it right i your mother and i love you what does really say i have heard this from my own mother way too many times and have yet to figure out what it means paula is a bit well more a bit both women are needy though they show it very differentlypaula has been involved with a friend of her darren who is a working on the house owned by her son while paula is working during the day may begins to have conversations and lunches with darren darren is a married man who has stayed with his because of their autistic son nicky but supposedly does not live in the home with his wifemay becomes attracted to darren because he is and she the connection they seem to have darren becomes attracted to may because she offers a kind of peace and understanding that he does not get from the other women in his life he also becomes too in money that may says she can give him to get away from it all though he is clearly not interested in her desire to join him on such a journey they end up sleeping together in the spare room during the day and may enjoys as a that she has not known in years nor had ever expected to know again as her daughter paula had her that she would leave the married darren this becomes part of mays that what she is is okayat a writing that paula leads may is introduced rather forced to get together with a to whom she is not attracted there is one scene where she has sex with the older man who clearly can barely perform and it truly painful and unsettling as we see the disgust on mays face as she endures the liaisoneventually paula discovers through some very graphic done by her mother that indeed her mother and darren have been having sexthis film will undoubtedly be seen by many in myriad will be divided at one point during paulas writing group may reveals through a short that she used to feel as though she hated her kids by the end of the day and would leave for pubs after they were asleep making sure to get back home her husbandclearly a good mother does not think of leaving children alone while she goes off to the local pub may however also had revealed earlier in the film that her husband did not her having any friends so she did not have any she did what he wanted her to do she was miserable but she put up with it because as she it was easier so while may was not the best mother for those inclined to have any sympathy for her one might see mays actions as the of a woman wanting to be sexual and to be a live for a few minutes in her lifetime a woman who just wanted someone to to her to know her as a being to have a friend and a loverpaula though neurotic and unhappy perhaps has become that way because of the parents who raised her certainly it is not difficult to understand why paula feels completely by her motherit is a film with more than i have and certainly one that will leave the with many perhaps conflicting reactions it is a film worth discussing and debating and above all worth seeingone thing the film leaves us with is the horror and fear of a lonely life no matter who is deemed right or who is deemed wrong by each viewer that theme of age and loneliness a sense of dread in most of us is inescapable

i not really fond of the cube movie it was a good idea but the annoying and characters always kept me it much did not really feel the need to its sequel but i heard they were making a third movie act as more of a prequel to the original i was intrigued that maybe they would fix some of the originals problems and provide us a memorable cast of characters well i thought wrongcube zero starts well enough by introducing us with the two characters charge of watching and maintaining the neverending of traps that the people in the cube the filmmakers succeed in providing a sense of mystery with the establishment of the two mens daily routine several are from it concerning the reason why people are send there and the true nature of the ones who run the entire operation all of which are left entirely to the viewer the acting was a weak but all in all the movies first half moved relatively wellwith the on of the two begins to develop serious about what he and later to go and help a group of the people here is everything rapidly starts to dissolve into dull cheesesent by the people who run the cube program we are introduced to the character jax along with his two a major reason as to why movie is failure to start of jax looks and talks more like a third rate villain taken directly from a bond movie complete with the ever eye that ruins any created by the first halfs relatively what is more is that it begins to feel more like a comedy rather than a serious movie with some incredibly corny lines perhaps the screenwriter got bored and did not care the acting itself degrades to a further low when the former watcher meets the group in the cube the entire interaction is painful to watch as is everything else following itagain failing to impress on anything but weak characters dialog and acting cube zero is a waste of time for those searching for a good horror movie

ugly shot poorly scripted and paced sequel to joe dantes thousand hundred and eightyone classic the howling one of the two or three only good werewolffilms ever made and yet it got rewarded by a of obnoxious and unendurable sequels like one if it is any consolation stirba is a sequel name only and there is absolutely no connection the characters or were introduced in dantes the plot here on a bloodthirsty of transsylvanian werewolves primarily female ones  by stirba stirba is by sybil danning who transforms a curvy old lady into a blond superbabe with bosom in the blink of eye and becomes all hairy sexually aroused her archenemy is played by a fatigue christopher lee his character  stefan crosscoe  is an occult investigator who travels to stirbas kingdom accompanied by an who friend to the werewolf cult in case you are exclusively looking filthy gore and gratuitous nuditythis is your film even the smallest killing is in great and we are even treated to exploding eyeballs and the vile of a dwarf who gets pierced on a pointy fence however if you want a substance or depth you sorely disappointed the are embarrassing and there is absolutely no tension to detect anywhere the scriptwriters constantly seem to confuse werewolves with vampires the transsylvanian setting garlic wooden stakes and dannings balcony is shamelessly exploited as the only gimmick during the endcredits a shot in which rips off her top is reedited repeatedly according to my fellow reviewer dr gore no less than seventeen times which is pretty pathetic and pointless the music is okay and some of the scenery is rather beautiful i am talking about the fiercelooking statues during the opening credits and the dark dungeons of stirbas castle the directing by philippe mora is a giant mess and  as far as i am concerned  his only worthwhile film remains the beast within released three years earlier

the the morning dr alan feinstone corbin bernsen his brookes linda hoffman wedding on the surface mr mrs feinstone seem have nice life a home in los angeles he has a successful career with responsibility but beneath things are very wrong alan discovers that brooke is having an affair with matt michael stadvec the swimming pool cleaner to add to his humiliation alan then discovers that matt is also having sex with paula roberts simms one of his next door to top it all off he owes the irs who are breathing down his neck a she would load of money alan starts to lose his mind he himself that everything is his patients teeth it is up to him to fix it that morning work he begins to take his frustrations anger out on his patients first he injures a young boy jody brian mclaughlin he sexual assaults a patient named april reign christa sauls after he that she is his wife deliberately performs an unnecessary painful procedure on alan also begins to take drugs as he completely loses it goes starting with his wife pool cleanerdirected by brian yuzna i thought the dentist was a good film tried something a bit different the by dennis paoli stuart gordon charles finch is more of a thriller straight slasher which came as a surprise to me as i was expecting the latter it would have been easy to make a slasher film like friday the thirteenth one thousand nine hundred and eighty with a high count a wise cracking dentist villain but what the dentist actually turned out to be is very different the dentist is at heart a study of one mans descent into madness it does a fine job although having that i not sure what he goes through is enough justification for his subsequent actions it moves along at a nice pace has a nice narrative in which i liked the constant connection alan makes between the he in his patients the decay he sees in the world around him is an way to pass ninety odd minutes it goes without saying that anyone with a phobia about the dentist probably should give this one a miss or you will never again i liked the too where the tables are turned i will say no moredirector yuzna does his usual fine job here in fact i do not think i have seen a yuzna film that i did not enjoy to some extent he predictably takes the opportunity to play on our fear of the dentist with some nice set pieces including pulling peoples teeth out sexually molesting them performing operations on drugs with the dreaded dentists drill there are some other gore scenes as well a dead dog someone slashed with a knife cut out tongues yuzna gives the film a certain style on what was probably a low budget he to tilt his which make for some nice i liked the shot where the camera is above someone being huge sprays of blood splatter on the floor in a nice wide overhead angletechnically the dentist is fine decent music production values although some of the special makeup effects a little the is pretty strong from everyone involved with corbin putting in a good performance the ever cool genre favourite ken foree turns up as detective gibbs one of los angeles finestthe dentist did not turn out like i had expected all the better for it if your a horror fan perhaps want something a bit different then this is well worth checking out i liked it think it is definitely worth a watch

how the grinch stole christmas instantly stole my heart and became my favorite movie from my very first viewing now eight viewings later it still has the same impact me as it did the first time i saw itscreenwriters jeffery price peter seaman who framed roger rabbit fame do job of the story of the grinch the screen ron howards the story to full life and jim carreys typically performance as the grinch steals the showsome of the film have claimed that it is not true to the spirit or principles of the original story having read the original story i must say i can not agree the movie makes the very same point about christmas and its true meaning as the original story indeed it the impact of the story by making it more personal by showing us how and why the grinch became what he wasmild spoilers they probably would not ruin the movie for you but if you have not seen it yet and you are one of those who wants to know nothing about a story until you have seen it you should skip the next paragraphsi think about everyone can relate to the grinchs terrible experiences in school i think all of us one time or were the unpopular one in school who was picked on i know i was and that is why i personally had so much sympathy for the grinch and what he throughand cindy lou who is naive idealism believing that nobody can be all bad was heart when everyone else had turned their backs on the grinch out of fear and cindy lou was determined to be his friend if only everyone could have such an attitudein fact i think the only thing that might have made the film a little better would have been to further tone down the adult and content it was already pretty restrained but any of this adult humor when the grinch first into martha may whoviers cleavage just does not fit in a story like thisthis ones well on its way to being a christmas classic taking a richly deserved place alongside the book and the chuck jones as a mustsee of christmas season

first let me say i not from the south but i am an american i do not love country music but i can stomach it i would never wear cowboy hat but i wear hats i do not live in a trailer but i do eat tuna salad and own a home what does that have do with this comment a lot if you are one those who say only country people love this movie this movie is loosely based the they loved and lost premise james bridges directs an american love story as as it gets in an of jerry springer and let us put it out there this film rings truer ever is coming of age and embarks on a life of his own with a little help from his aunt and so he moves to the big city with them bud finds himself drawn into the local tonk world for the only escape a blue collar man can afford he quickly meets sissy who is from a similar and the have a whirlwind romance filled with painful ups and downs this plot takes so many turns that one has to sit for a few minutes they get hooked marriage is a focus here that is missed early in the film they marry and we view the transition from being single to married the film highlights some of the struggles a has when she marries an fashioned man it also brings into view the male ego with women and competitionbud is challenged and is excited when mickys puts in an electronic bull sissy gets ideas of having fun on it too but is quickly reminded that she is married and need to it the emotion between the two is raw and expressive and the plot continues from there especially when they note this is giving some of the storyline away split and sissy falls for an ex con with a for abuse and she soon realizes that the grass is not greener on the other sidehow anyone can compare bud to vinnie barbirino is shocking to me john travolta gave an exceptional performance that was worthy recognition he was believable and real the scene where he shaves his and you first see him the barstill gives me goosebumps mind you i am not a huge travolta fan but come on i see why sissy was kicking of her boots so early in the film deb was so real that you found yourself with her as she pens a note of emotions to bud after sneaking in to clean his house during their break up the supporting cast was incredible wes played by scott glenn gave a first performance that made you hate him and curse him as he abused sissy madolyn smithosborne as buds mistressgirlfriend was so authentic that large girls across the yous to wake up chested to wear the clothes she donned in the film my biggest kudoss to barry corbin and brooke anderson as buds aunt and uncle they seemed like someone is aunt and uncle somewhere in texas and however small their role they made the film so much bigger and two memorable scenes were the parton contest and the unforgettable scene where bud and his aunt stand outside after one of the characters death the dialog between them is touchingif you can watch this for what it is a true american love story then i recommend that you take it for what it isa film before it is time that gave us into a world unlike our own but real enough for our enjoyment and entertainment if this world sounds similar to yours then you will enjoy it so much more the music however dated is sure to send you back in time if you are over thirty of age

xizao is rare little movie it is simple and and the same time so in emotion and joy the story is simple and the theme and new is introduced in the first scenes this theme is the essence of the movie but it would have fallen if it was not for the magnificent and the portraying aging master liu is a of chinas preexpansion days he a bath house in an old neighbourhood single scene set in the bath house is a source of jelaousy for us out unhappy not even can find any flaws in this settingmaster lius mentally handicapped son er ming is the second truly powerful in the movie coupled with his modernlife brother the interactions between these people and the various visitors the bath house are amazingly detailed and heartfelt with some scenes packing so much emotion it is beyond almost everything seen in movieswith its regimecritical message this movie was not only censored but also given unreasonably small coverage it could be a coincidence but when a movie of this caliber is virtually impossible to find even on the internet you can not help getting suspiciousso help free speech and the movie world buy rent copy this wonderful movie and if you happen to own the dvd if there even is one then share share share

i caught this screening at the sundance film festival and was in awe over the absolute power this film has it is an the psychological effects our brave soldiers who join the with hopes that they will protect and serve our country with honor as well as be taken care of by our government for it the film details the psychological changes that takes place in boot as the soldiers are turned into killers for their country and put into the war and the after effects once they return home it also portrays the that killing has on the psyche it pays homage the soldiers and never ever the soldiers unlike other instead criticizes a system that is not prepared to and does not take care of all the physical and psychological needs of the returned vetsthis film is powerful moving emotional and thought provoking it stands as a call to arms to support our troops not only by buying stickers and going to parades but by actually listening to them and helping to support a change in the way their health and well being is taken care of after the killing endsthe best film of the festival so far

halloween is the story boy who was misunderstood as a child he takes out his problems his older sister whom he murders the of the film this is the of things come from michael myersdonald pleasance plays the who is been studying myers for he knows that something is different about him something mysteriously evil this evil will not be contained and it can not be stoppedafter an escape from an myers tracks down his younger sister if he kills her there may be an end to the troubles of this misunderstood boy but he seems to have problems in finishing his sister off as other get in the way he manages to take them out while still looking for that one girl he needsthere have been a lot of those horror movies involving teenagers getting to pieces by a or gruesome killer but this one started it all of if you think about it most of those horror movies we all remember are the ones that have freddy kruger or jason chasing around naked girls well if it was not for halloween those would not have haunted our dreams when we were childrenhalloweens john carpenter got a lot out of the horror movies of the fiftys and combined everything he knew into one film that scared the hell out of a lot of people back in the late seventys this solidified him as a director to watch and also jump started the career of jamie lee curtis who plays the girl being stalked by the masked killerthis film may seem cliché today but back then there was not much out there this it is been copied from and ripped off of but halloween will remain the horror movie it still gives you listening to carpenters thrilling music while we see victim get chased by that michael myers

this independent film was one the best the tall grass film festival that i have ever seen there i loved it there are so many things that was great about the film top of all that the cast and crew that i had the opportunity meet were absolutely phenomenali thought that avi did great job in his role and ricky ullman was absolutely true to his role for a disney i was amazed at his talent to be able to from cheesy teen comedy to such an adult role with no problems the talent in the film was amazing the was just great if you want to see an independent film this is one really that you should seei think that mr gruver would have been so proud to have such a submission in his festival and his parents loved the movie so much when it won the favorite they and saw it again this truly was a great film it was dark and funny and and truly emotional it was just fabulous i honestly just so enthused by this film and i really do not want to spoil it for any one just see it and truly be amazed at it i think that these film makers really have what it takes to go places and i hope to see more work from them in the future
