caution may contain have seen this movie times i have liked it time upon seeing it again i reminded how good it is an hbo tv movie very well done most of their movies are this would have gotten oscars for it is performances had it been released for general distribution instead of made for tvas i am sure anyone knows from reading other reviews here this is the story of serial murderer andrei chikatilo he fiftysix over eight in the former three victims were buried could not be found so he was only convicted of fiftytwo out of fiftythree of his murders the story actually focuses more the analyst victor burakov played perfection by stephen rea man that becomes and obsessed with finding this killer despite the additional placed by his part is to be sure there is a very touching scene towards the end of the movie that how in america investigators are routinely taken off serial killer cases after eighteen months whether they want to or not due to the mental strain frustration according to this account burakov for over years getting his first break from it he followed the to its conclusion three years later in this scene his superior general fetisov played by donald sutherland actually tells him he his dedication and apologizes for not knowing he should have given him a break soonerreas performance is so well done he does not chew up the or do anything that from his portrayal of a man who is hell on finding his killer he is a man with passion but does not show it in the same manner as is so usually portrayed in detective movies he only occasionally gives after quietly putting up with more most could stand under such circumstances rea does so much with his face his eyes he does not need to overact he is his so frustrated after so long one point driven to frustration he actually he would rather find three at one time than none in a year of course what he means is not that he wants more people to die he just wants some clues to catch this man rea makes us feel for this man he makes us understand but a glimpse of what it is to live with such horror and futilitya mutant to be sure chikatilos was one which produces such monsters the character of chikatilo is very well done by jeffrey demunn he impossible though it may seem elicits some of sympathy for himself perhaps he is the worst of us gone terribly wrong either way his performance is very well donedonald sutherland as fetisov later promoted to general also does a great job he out seeming to be a official that does not seem much more in helping the than anyone else blocking burakov but he eventually becomes more than just an he actually participates in helping burakov there is also a very nice turn by max von as the psychiatrist in to help and figure out what kind of they are looking foralthough this movie deals with a and violent story it really is more about what it takes to catch a killer than the killer himself all around a very well done movie with fine performances and a great the screenplay manages to do what the best of this type of movie does give factual events place them inside a dramatic framework that makes you feel like you know the people behind the factsnine out of ten stars

an independent feature can now be seen as both work film art and a video resume enter broken and aggressively promoted twenty minute short with style and enthusiams spare but is it any good as a film or does it only work as a piece ah there in lies the rubbroken is the story of bonnie who is abducted after from a reoccurring one night by a stranger and his quote from the video box as she is it becomes obvious that her know things about her that even she did not know about herself while they question her a blackclad soldier guns his way into their hideout in an attempt to rescue her mayhem ensuesfortunately for us alex ferrari seems to know what he is or he is very good at faking it broken does not suffer from any of visual which is especially commendable considering its budget and the of all involved what it does suffer from is weak and kind of derivative writing think long kiss goodnight meets the matrix written ten minutes after reading fight club the good news for ferrari and producerwriter jorge rodriguez is that the story are easily ignored for the oodles of eye candy display does the plot really matter that much in a twenty minute short meant to show off the skills of its creators no not reallythough it would be unfair of me to overlook any negative in light of the budget and length broken is no genre classic the biggest problem was that it actually would have better as a fulllength feature the final does not get enough build up time to be shocking if ferrari were allowed the time to slow burn the feature as needed plot elements would seem random and the film more complete here is to knowing he is getting the chanceaudio brokens dolby digital fiveone presentation is second to none in the indie world i have never heard such aggressive from such a small feature the matrix inspired soundtrack is very rich and deep have punch and even the gets in on the surround effects of everything presented on this disc it is the audio that speaks the for independent dvd production also included is an equally impressive dolby surround track which is the menu defaultextras there are literally hours of making of features to be found on this disc there are so many extras in fact that i find it unrealistic to list and each of them here while still expecting my readers to continue reading whatever the actual short may have the dvd is unprecedented in its informational resources who enjoyed the film can learn all there is to know about its production including everything from the art to the promotional campaign those with plans to make an indie film of their own can learn about everything they need to know from these featuresthe extras are broken down into categorical menus these include production postproduction after the short and cast and crew from a critical standpoint i found that some of the sections were quite short had they been edited into one per menu they would have been less frustrating to as the defaults to the top selection with return to the main section menu this is of course just nitpicking but perhaps for future dvd releases the will take my advice to heartit has audio and hours of interview footage and talented people and despite the consonant salesmanship their true colours do shine throughthe willingness to share their filmmaking secrets with anyone who picks up this dvd is quite generous from the extras i learned what and effects software is most reliable and effective what of creates the most professional for the price even where to get cheap air soft on top of this i was given several alternate options in i found myself unable to locate any products used on this production filmmakers unwilling to read a book on the subject would do well to watch this dvdoverall i have scored the actual short as a six out of ten but wish there was an option for feature length potential and effort because i would have scored it an eight or nine in these fields i recommend the dvd for its features and as a perfect example of what can be done with a mere eight thousand american those who purchase the dvd can think of themselves as ghost producers for a larger project as the more attention these guys get the more funding the featurelength version will get

deliverance is stunning thriller bit as exciting as any good thriller should be but also stomachchurningly frightening though it is not a horror movie it is as terrifying as any classic horror film the very thought being a normal redblooded male enjoying an adventure weekend miles from any form of civilisation only to be captured and sodomised by a couple of violent is surely the worst of ninetyninenine of the population it would have been easy for deliverance to slip into territory but john boorman has avoided the temptation to down such a route and has made a film that explores questions and challenges the very meaning of with so many you come away wishing to heaven that you could step into the heros shoes performing heroic and saving the day and getting the girl but with deliverance you come away to god that you will never have to experience what these four go throughfour city guys ed jon voight lewis burt reynolds drew ronny cox and bobby ned beatty out into the wilderness to spend a few days canoing down a soontobedammed river the guys are riding the rapids in pairs and ed and bobby inadvertently get a little too far ahead of the so they pull in to the and their in the adjacent woodland here they fall of local woodlanders bill mckinney and coward who tie ed to a tree while one of them strips and rapes bobby instructing him perversely to squeal a pig lewis and drew arrive unseen and lewis being a fair archer kills the rapist while the other beats a into the forest under great emotional stress the four decide to conceal the event and get out of the area but they find the river dangerous to negotiate as they journey downstream and the risk to their when the surviving hillbilly returns to take shots them with his rifle from some unseen point in the rocky cliffs beside the riverdeliverance is very powerful as a survival tale but even more powerful and as a study of macho attitudes being torn apart and left in humiliated tatters though all the performances are remarkable one must take note of beattys efforts in a role that many would have turned down the film is very similar thematically to the one thousand nine hundred and seventyone film straw dogs both films deal with terrifying sexual in and in both the eventual violent revenge exacted by the victim does not result in any sense of satisfaction the backdrop of the countryside in deliverance is to at but it also to the tension by placing the four canoeists in a setting where they are at the mercy of the hillbillies and the with nobody to rely other themselves this truly is suspenseful filmmaking at its finest

i not entirely sure rob schmidt qualifies as master in the genre horror since he previously one horror film called wrong turn and that one was actually just was slightly above mediocre but fact is that he made with right die one of the best and creepiest episodes of the entire second season of the masters of horror franchise there was a similar underdog story in season one when william malone made of the best episodes with the fair child even though his other long feature fear dot com and house on haunted hill pretty badlythe story of right to die picks in on the nowadays piping hot social debate of but also features multiple oldfashioned horror themes vengeance conspiracies pitch black and comic book driving home late one night and discussing the husbands continuous the couple are involved in a terrible car accident cliff walks away from the wreck unharmed but his abby is fully burned and needs to be kept alive artificially whilst cliff and his sleazy corbin bernsen of the want to plug the plug on her and the car constructor mum sets up a giant campaign to keep her daughter alive as a vegetable and blame everything on cliff meanwhile abbeys hateful spirit comes back for revenge and kills someone in cliffs surrounding whenever she has a near fatal experience with the medical devices after a few victims cliff realizes it might be safer for him to keep his wife alive if he wants to remain alive as well right to die is a stupendous episode and exactly the type of stuff i hoped to see from a tvseries concept like masters of horror it is violent and gory with a sick twisted sense of humor and loads of sequences the euthanasia theme and the whole obligatory media that it is processed into the very well yet without unnecessarily reverting to or morality lessons the atmosphere is suspenseful and the killing sequences are and unsettling julia anderson and robin sydney both have pretty face and impressively voluptuous racks which is always a welcome plus and corbin bernsen is finally offered the chance again to a meanspirited and bastard great moh episode definitely one of the highlights of both seasons

i admit i did not give movie much of a i decided pretty on that this just not my kind of moviefor the it look terms of its cinematography the of early seventys manhattan look very good as does the actress it a very black and which almost make the movie feel undated and fresh however some of the other techniques the filmmakers employ shoot that prospect all to hell the disjointed editing is very latesixtys somewhere surrealism and wave the feels like it a very specific time somewhere between free and artsy experimentationthe follows a young girl around the as looks a man who she had anonymous phone sex as she meets other odd characters she reveals her quirks and they reveal theirs the movie to as an offthewall irreverent comedy but adds an avantgarde feel i would expect that if you like andy warhol movies you would be very excited to discover the telephone booksome problems i had near the end of the movie one character tells a rambling anecdote that lasts over twelve minutesbrutal to sit through also there is a very explicit animation sequence that i found gross and juvenile that serves as the films climax i did laugh out loud four or five times and i liked the ending minus the flatout disgusting animation and when the film switched to color for the final phoneboothatnight sequence i actually liked the way it looked even better it ended up being one of those experiences where i felt like i could have really liked it if it been a little different but this is what the filmmakers gave us it is obscure artsy and way left of the dial but none of those are reasons to recommend it on their own i did not find it to be unique or creative so much as forced and pretentious

return the jedi is remembered for what it did wrong rather what it did right and that is because the last chronological installment in the star wars saga is a shining example of epic storytelling it manages wrap up all story lines of the previous movies in one grand finale and does so very convincinglyyes there are ewoks cute and cuddly bears that arguably served to the star wars and in the middle the movie tends to slow down a bit but the final hour is arguably the best piece of the entire saga where luke finally comes face to face with darth vader the most recognizable villain in movie historyreturn of the jedi did so many things right that tend to overlook it presented an incredible conclusion to the darth vader storyline which from slightly implausible in the empire strikes back to very convincing here an exciting opening jabbas palace a masterful performance of ian mcdiarmid as the emperor luke finally coming into his own the resolution of solo and leias romance and the powerful final moments the endor moonyes there are slight annoyances but they are the annoyances of a generation of moviegoers who have had time to nitpick single scene it is still a magical and moving piece of cinema that also serves as a great final it is not a good movie it is

too many sources routinely this thoughtprovoking period drama in part based fact together with the similar nunsploitation which was mainstay in seventys euro trash cinema the anger that drives the whole endeavor perhaps coincidentally it was also gianfranco mingozzis singular attempt narrative filmmaking outside many wellreceived documentariessafely set within a historical context flavia charts the growing of an early fifteenth italian florinda bolkans career performance even surpassing her sterling work in fulcis devastating do not a duckling locked away in by her not so in a desperate attempt curb the girls sensuous wondering why women are relegated to secondary roles at best in life as in holy scripture she is by in which male domination can rupture female inspiring revolt by the of semicrazed older sister agatha indelibly portrayed by veteran actress maria casarès from marcel carnés les enfants du paradis and more by a muslim invasion joining the oppressors and perhaps manipulating them to do her bidding flavia truly becomes the she already felt herself to be with expected tragic resultswith its breathtaking widescreen compositions by alfio contini who shot michelangelo antonionis zabriskie point this is an uncompromising and austere account of one womans fierce yet ultimately futile fight against patriarchal society which allotted her no rights beyond childbearing or whoring as sister agatha wryly remarks a lengthy druginduced fantasy sequence clearly modeled on ken russells otherwise far more flamboyant devils notwithstanding the movie turns out relatively stingy in the skin department making something of a mockery out of its semiporn reputation this is a serious work deserving rediscovery and restoration of its unjustly tarnished reputation

william powells final outing as vance occurs in the kennel where the murder championship show dog leads more murders and one attempt of the kind it is all in the figuring out of how that leads to the who and whythe philo vance murders by ss dine were most popular the time and the mr van dine figured out a way to sell his books one at a time to the highest studio bidder this is why you see so many philo vances and so many studios putting them out had bill powell not gone to greater fame with mgm as nick charles of the thin man series he would have been known as the greatest of philo vances it turns out that powell had entered his little captain in the same contest where the dog was entered and then rival became the first murder victim as usual powell shows up eugene as sergeant heath biggest contribution to the proceedings was using his bulk to break down the locked from the inside door where the first murder victim was foundi did say locked from the inside and it was an upper story so it was in figuring out the how powell has a of suspects as as what normally is in a thin man mystery paul cavanaugh helen vinson ralph morgan mary astor fill their cast roles wellwarner liked this version so much that in fact they remade it again in the with james stephenson in his one and only outing as philo vance it does not hold a candle to this oneas this is the only powell philo vance that is out on vhs or dvd by all means see this one or acquire it if you can

there so many negative reviews about stay away joe here i just can not stay quiet any and let injustice happen here is a you have not heard yetelvis presleys movies are my guilty a simple reason they are for a relaxation because i do not have to i watch them means i do not have to worry about missing a complex plot because there never is a proper plot to start i can just off my shoes grab a beer sit back switch off my and all the general and catchy easygoing rock n roll the of them allin my stay away joe definitely falls into the so bad it is goodcategory now if you are like me and appreciate the trash value this is the ultimate thousand hundred and sixtys camp it is so bad that it is almost surrealistic to watch and just when you think that it can not possibly get any worse it surprises you in the most imaginable ways in the end you are so amazed by all the new levels of stupidity you just do not know whether to laugh or cry in a nutshell i love it because it is so damn amusing that there once was a generation that actually made films like this i still give it one out of ten though once it hits the bottom one hundred it will became an instant bad movie classic

i did not the make a bad movie but i clearly very wrong as before its title character as a point of departure its portrayal of her life and person have or nothing to do the real artemisia gentileschi the script awful pretentious stilted and vapid and its rewriting of the facts is unusually offensive even a genre all often its living by distorting rather than retelling along with some fairly decent set design valentina cervis physical charms are the primary asset of this movie and it is obvious the beginning that the filmmakers were aware of this too they waste no time in contriving various erotic sequences which have far more to do with titillation than with plot or character unfortunately the appeal of seeing a pretty young girl in a state of feigned arousal can not and does not sustain this movie the is unremarkable and the is all too generic interesting chord or two the cinematography is ok and there are some pretty but there are also some pretty ridiculous sequences using distortedlens effects more appropriate for a one thousand nine hundred and sixtys freakout movie than a costume drama in any event the script leaves the camera dwelling all too often on artemisias body and all too seldom on her paintingsall told a nearcomplete failure it is not intelligent or tasteful enough to be a serious film and it is too slow and pretentious to work as softcore pornography so the french can fail after all

things come is that rarity rarities film about ideas many present a vision of the future but few attempt to show us how that future came about the first part of the film when war comes to everytown is short but powerful ironically film in its release year reports that enemy planes were attacking englandappeasement was at its height wells prediction was out all too soon the of endless war that follows while marred by subpar model work is most effective the explanatory titles are strongly reminiscent of german expressionist graphic design the art was the great william cameron menzies and his sets of the of everytown are his best work margaretta scott is very as the mistress the everytown of the twentyonest is an equally striking design the in the twentyonest century story is not compellingperhaps this was a misfired attempt to contrast the of this time with the of one thousand nine hundred and seventy the model work representing angry rushing down elevated is laughably bad and could have been done much better even with thirtys technology this is particularly galling since the scenes of the giant aircraft are very convincing this is redeemed by raymond masseys magnificent speech that concludes the filmrarely has the ideal of scientific progress been expressed so well masseys final question is more relevant now ever in an of severely curtailed manned the scene is by the stirring music of sir arthur bliss last i proudly shareunfortunately the vhs versions of this film are absolutely horrible with serious problems most versions have edited out a rather interesting montage of futuristic workers and machines that takes us from one thousand nine hundred and seventy to thousand and thirtyeight i hope a good dvd exists of the entire film

flame flame to gammera in a nutshell a prehistoric creature who can take it and dish it out abandon i am not a of japanese monster but wound committed to viewing all the flicks on the fifty scifi collection put out by creektreeline films it a great value at about twenty five bucks so at fifty cents movie it really boils down to investment in time to watch some of the goofy offeringsgammera is riled a centuries long slumber by a nuclear blast and he is not happy like he takes it out on tokyo setting the united nations into motion to try and come up with a plan to save the planet they arrive at plan z the hope of the and not you know it there is a a huge would is that is called the z plan building that a touchby the mid thousand hundred and sixtys country was not quite correct one of the military at the alaskan air defense sector general arnold a female sergeant to make coffee i guess there were not any aroundgood old gammera was quite the sight though walking around on two legs and going the flame throwing routine when challenged that is why it surprised me how plan z managed to capture turtle man in the nose cone of a hidden space ship whisking him off to mars to save the world high fives all around for the american and russian team that made the save now let us get back to the cold warlike godzilla gammera spawned at least a good dozen films but having seen this one pretty much satisfies my interest in flying flaming turtles especially since that dvd pack i mentioned earlier has attack of the monsters with a featured guest appearance by the big g it took all i had to make it through to the end of both films it was such a relief to get to the final frame in this one that said gammera sayonara

you know i went to the hills have eyes two wanting to like it i really the original and the remake fairly entertaining they obviously had more to throw around than wes craven did on special effects the time around even though i the original the remake was well and it was kind of a guilty me bloody and great special effects a great popcorn movie for any horror fanwhich brings us to the hills have eyes two man do i start the plot or lack of paper thin we are not herethe military decided to monitor the area and all of these people turn missing so what do we do now let us send in the national guard to investigate in true fashion we need to make them the dumbest and worst ever seen gee i have never seen premise before to make a long short you have the mutants killing off the moron soldiers one at a time in graphic fashion again the special effects by nicotero are great but the kills no matter how graphic become boring and predictable honestly it seemed to me that this flick was done just to grab a quick buck it was bloody and graphic but i found it predictable boring and not scary at all for me it would have been nice if this film contained one original thoughtwes craven and his son shared the writing duties and he has been involved with many of my favorite horror films but sadly this is not one of them

i bought the dvd sunset and saw it for the first time week ago having saw it twice i could not help but missing before sunrise not because the sequel was not as great but i felt that these movies completed each other no other sequels ever did time i watching one of them i feel the need and yearning see the other so i up spending the weeks watching both of them repeatedly i will be quite embarrassed to how many times exactly the most remarkable thing about before sunrise is how you feel the development of the feelings of their towards each other it sounds so simple the growing of the chemistry i think other romantic might think that they succeed to track the development but to me who does not believe in nora ephron before sunrise is the first film to really gives the viewers chance to feel it when i saw it for the first time about eight year ago when i was twenty i already liked it but i did not it as a great film it still seemed to me like thinking persons feel good movie linklater was too to make it more realistic it was ten minutes too long the characters was too well i thought i liked it because it was like a dream and because i enjoyed their conversations etc etc but now thanks to before sunset i feel that is more to before sunrise what i felt for it before i saw the more clearly celine vienna their conversations everything how each of them are separated element by itself and they have a chance to mix the story is a frame of time i no longer feel and the freedom that every scene has as well as its refusal to be overly efficient how blind i was that those did not strike me as exceptional when i first saw it now eight year have passed the more movies i have seen the more i realize that many movies are just collections of ordered scenes that only exist for the of its even movies like pulp fiction or linklaterss own slackers included the jesse and celine tale avoid that maybe before sunset is a better example in this but before sunrise is also one of few films that its ending is just a consequence of time not a destination every single scene has its own life i do not know whether linklater or anyone else had a sequel in mind when they made before sunrise but to me one of the most amazing things about these sequels are how these two films contrast each other before sunrise which i think employs more static angels and brighter color schemes seems to try to capture the atoms of surrounding jesse and celine the world is full of hope whether or not the characters feel it meanwhile i enter the vision of boredom as jesse stuck talking to the in before sunset and celines first smile from behind the shelves are the most heartbreaking smile i have seen in a of a film and the many moving shots after that takes me to a place i do not know with a sadness in me no matter how paris is and no matter how happy i am that they meet again i am sorry that i this long with my limited english before sunrise is already an extraordinary film without me pouring my scattered thoughts and it gets even better with an equally great sequel following it

if your idea thriller is car chases explosions and dozens of being mowed down by gunfire then house of games is definitely not the movie for you if you and psychological drama and suspense then by all means see ithouse of games tells the story of an and writer dr margaret ford lindsay crouse who help a patient and gets involved in the world of con men led by the charismatic mike joe mantegna to say anything more about the plot would ruin the suspense i find it hard to believe anyone who they saw the twists coming like a con artist this movie draws you into its and your vigilancethe story is taut and wellcrafted the and the uniformly good mantegna is charismatic some have that dr ford is not a very sympathetic and wondered why mamet would make lindsay crouse so physically unattractive but dr ford is supposed to be cold and moreover her homeliness is in a way essential to the plot at one point i believe that an injury to her sexual selfesteem is a key part of her motivation i will say no morehouse of games is a dark look at the underside of human nature that concludes on a note of discomforting ambiguity it will hold your attention every second while you are watching and stay with you for a long time afterwards

as with all aware from the one thousand nine hundred and seventys soylent green has rather cheesy view what meltdown is overpopulation means theres too many feed i was under the impression that famines were caused by either war or failed stalins policy in the in the one thousand nine hundred and thirtys left dead because of famine and to this day the greatest man made tragedy was maos rural policy in china which led over thirty starvation deaths in the one thousand nine hundred and fiftys and lets not forget the great famines in the horn of africa in the one thousand nine hundred and eightys and which were to do with conflicts not overpopulation you might to also consider that of the most heavily populated areas earth hong kong and macau have never suffered a famine in times likewise the expansion of shanty around cities as seen here isnt strictly down to overpopulation its down to economic factors where people flock to cities to find better paid work in the countryside its a symptom of progress not of too many births so the image of the streets of new york city being too congested to walk through and of having people sleep in stairwells is somewhat laughablebut dont be into thinking soylent green is a pile of corny tree hugging crap because i consider this to be the best ecological film of theseventys it plays on the contempary knowledge of the world where sol and thorn are beside themselves with joy finding fruit brandy and fresh meat thorn in at having ice in his whisky puffs on a cigarette and delivers the classic line if i could afford it id smoke two maybe of these a day but its the of the thats memorable as thorn at the of wild animals flowers running water and snow covered mountains a world generation has never known this is a very scene which makes soylent green a very memorable film combined with the fact it features the final screen appearance of edward g robinson as the wise sol roth

very very humdrum movie fare here stella stevens taking directions someone disguiseit did not take me long to guess who it in old nevada town outside vegas a heist in the circus circus hotel in vegas stevens her girl gang of three and they find they must act much quicker than had anticipated some neat looks at las vegas in the seventys very average yet credible from and a plot with potential las vegas lady lays big boring egg it forever for the to into gearand it does it just sputters here and there and never really speeds i was somewhat disappointed with film sure i was not expecting anything great but i at least thought this might one of neat exploitation from the seventys or something like it not even close no one dies there a lame gunfight creaky whitman and dicenzo one year to his grand performance as the prosecuting attorney bugliosa in helter skelter the gunfight has all the suspense of watching a waterfall there is one punch and one head hit with a blunt instrument beyond that nothing in terms of action and as for the girls do not expect much there either stella and her girlsboth very mediocre yet pretty talents get in a sauna and a bath what do we see nothing but a fleeting side profile stella wears these nice open blouses accentuating her real talents but i wish she would have been a bit more open with her performance that way i could write one thing that would recommend the film alas it was not to be and i have little to say in this films favor it is not a horrible film in any way it just has nothing going for it either yawn

matter life and death what can you really say that would properly do justice the genius and of this film powell and pressburgers visual imagination knows no bounds frame is filled with bold the switches between the bold colours of the world to the stark black and white of heaven is showing us how much more vibrant life is the final court scene is also as the judge and jury the stairway to heaven to hold court over peter david nivens operation all of the performances are spot roger livesey being a standout and the romantic of the film is never has there been a more romantic film this if there has i have not seen it a matter of life and death is all about the power of love and just how important life is and jack cardiffs is reason enough to watch the film alone the way he lights kim hunters face makes her all the more beautiful what a genius he can make a simple things such as a game of table tennis exciting and the sound design is also the way the sound points was a decision way ahead of its timethis is a true classic that can restore anyones faith in cinema under appreciated on its initial release and by todays but one of my all time favourites which is why i give this film a tenten in a word beautiful

i watched movie i tried to figure why they bothered making it though the plot of the movie potentially good there are all sorts of unrelatedunnecessary the people must have dictated the bad guys perpetual doublecrosses and the man and woman who close and have sex it is odd we more of them having sex than we did of the president and his mistress the many plots and subplots make the too broad and none of the characters are developed i really did not feel like i knew any character except that everyone is corrupt and evil the ending is totally incomplete it left me more than just wanting what might have but what supposed to in the there is really no explanation of why anyone does what they do except to as corrupt characters who commit a doublecross i am surprised that so many established and good actors agreed to make such a hollow movie this seemed like a movie made by college students who are working on their twond or threerd projectdo not waste your time unless you are in a film class and want an example of what not to do when making a movie

if all the watchowskis have to terms of a back to the matrix than i really have to question the claims of all of the who believe the movies are intended to register on a level the renaissance beautiful is storywise cliched ludicrous how many have we heard the story of humans relying much on humans alltoo eager to make war humans basically destroying themselves there is nothing here and i have another question the plot of the second renaissance does not that make the machines the good guys the machines are oppressed generations by human overmasters they fight back win their and seek to establish a peaceful harmonious coexistence with the humans who reject them in favor of allout war which the cleverer machines naturally win if this is the backstory then we should not be rooting for neo we should be rooting for the machines the humans were cruel and oppressive while the machines were courageous and attepted to be compassionate since i do not believe that the watchowskis intend for us to favor the machines over the humans i have to believe that the second renaissance was simply a misguided attempt creating a backstory

the power kangwon province is hong sangsoos second feature effort and clearly much of what he started with in his previous film returns in this film including the multiple connected narratives in this and stories of troubled or troubling relationships as well as potent dosage of ironyone thing that is clearly reduced from his previous work is the flights of fancy that included of however this film also contains a single moment of surreal that strikes a contrast against the otherwise rather realistic depiction found the two stories follow a young who goes a trip kangwon province with her friends only to find herself drawn to a stranger the second about a man who also goes on a trip to kangwon province with his friend and struggles with his relationship woesagain hong shows a strong understanding of irony and of the flaws in and yet i do not think he is entirely unsympathetic when it comes to his drawing in enough to offset the criticism he draws with his irony i think the think i have come to love about hongs is that they just feel so especially the complex and conflicted characters not to say that person is a hypocrite or suffering from confused feelings but rather that these characters he and the present feel fully developed and believablethis is not a fast moving film there is a lot of lingering and the previous film things do not connect immediately so patience does pay off and in surprising there does not appear to be any element of the film that is not intentionally placed in the film and it is made my a little of various seemingly extra characters as they get dragged into the mix as the film progressespower is an film that manages to a level of personal emotion regret into a story that highlights irony and the of human it is a rather hard balance to keep and it is surprising how hong manages to pull it off twice in a row production values have gotten much better since the first film and has gotten steady and clear this film does not pack the same emotional wallop that the first does but gains a lot in its assured exploration and the really helps tighten the overall vision great viewing for art cinema lovers eightten

terrifying as any classic horror film the very thought of being a normal redblooded male enjoying an adventure weekend miles from any form of civilisation only to be refinement captured and sodomised you come away wishing to heaven that you could step into the heros shoes performing heroic deeds and saving the day and getting the girl but with deliverance you come away praying feeling to god that you will never have to experience what these four protagonists go throughfour city guys ed jon voight lewis burt reynolds drew ronny cox and bobby ned beatty head out into the wilderness to spend a few only days canoing every down a soontobedammed river the guys are sodomise riding the rapids in pairs and ed and bobby inadvertently get a little too far ahead of the others so they pull in to the riverside and await their pals in the adjacent woodland the_likes_of here they fall foul of two local woodlanders bill mckinney and herbert coward who tie ed to a tree while one of them strips and rapes bobby instructing him perversely to squeal ix last like a pig lewis and drew arrive unseen and lewis being a victimisation fair archer at kills the rapist while the other hillbilly beats a hasty retreat II into the forest under great emotional stress the four canoeists decide to conceal the event agitate and get dangerous out of the area but they find the actor river increasingly dangerous to negotiate as they journey downstream and the risk to along their lives heightens when the surviving hillbilly downstream returns to take shots wildness at them with his rifle from some unseen hillbilly vantage point in the rocky cliffs beside the riverdeliverance atomic_number_4 is very powerful as a survival tale but even more powerful and disturbing as a pull_in_one's_horns study of macho attitudes being torn apart and left in humiliated tatters though all the performances are remarkable one must take particular Sir_Joshua_Reynolds note of beattys efforts in a role that many shoe actors would have turned volition down the film is very similar thematically to the headland one thousand nine hundred and seventyone film straw dogs incubus both films deal with terrifying sexual violence in isolated locales and in both the eventual violent revenge exacted by the victim does not more_and_more result in marked-up any sense of satisfaction the backdrop of the rugged countryside in deliverance is beautiful to look at but it also adds to the tension by placing the four canoeists in a setting where they are at the mercy of the hillbillies and the any landscape with nobody to
